title: Verlage importieren
excerpt: Importiere mehrere Verlage gleichzeitig aus einer CSV- oder Excel-Datei. Spare Zeit beim Aufbau deiner Mediendatenbank durch Massenimport.
excerptEn: Import multiple publishers at once from a CSV or Excel file. Save time building your media database with bulk import.

### Schritt 3: Daten in die Vorlage eintragen

### Schritt 4: Datei speichern

### Schritt 5: Datei hochladen

### Schritt 6: Duplikat-Behandlung w√§hlen

### Schritt 7: Import starten

### Schritt 8: Ergebnis pr√ºfen

## H√§ufige Fehler und L√∂sungen

### "Firmenname ist erforderlich"

**Problem:** Eine Zeile hat keinen Wert in der Spalte "Firmenname*"

**L√∂sung:** F√ºge f√ºr jede Zeile einen Firmennamen hinzu oder entferne leere Zeilen

### "Ung√ºltiger Typ"

**L√∂sung:** Nutze einen dieser Werte:

### "Telefon-/E-Mail-Format ung√ºltig"

**L√∂sung:**

1. √ñffne die CSV-Datei in einem Text-Editor (z.B. Notepad++)
2. Pr√ºfe, ob Semikolon (;) als Trennzeichen verwendet wird
3. Stelle sicher, dass die Datei UTF-8-kodiert ist

## Tipps f√ºr erfolgreiche Importe

### 1. Teste mit kleinen Datens√§tzen

Bevor du hunderte Verlage importierst:
- Starte mit 3-5 Test-Eintr√§gen
- Pr√ºfe das Ergebnis im CRM
- Erst dann importiere die vollst√§ndige Liste

### 2. Nutze Tags f√ºr Kategorisierung

Tags helfen dir, Verlage sp√§ter zu filtern:
- "Premium" f√ºr wichtige Verlagspartner
- "Regional" f√ºr lokale Verlage
- "Fachverlag" f√ºr spezialisierte Verlage

### 3. Pflege Kontaktdaten vollst√§ndig

Je mehr Informationen du importierst:
- Desto einfacher ist die sp√§tere Kontaktaufnahme
- Desto besser funktioniert die Duplikat-Erkennung
- Desto professioneller wirkt deine Datenbank

- Du kannst sie bei Bedarf aktualisieren

### 5. Importiere in Etappen

- So kannst du Fehler besser eingrenzen

## Nach dem Import

Nach erfolgreichem Import solltest du:

1. **Verlage pr√ºfen** ‚Äì Stichprobenartig die importierten Daten kontrollieren
2. **Publikationen zuordnen** ‚Äì Falls noch nicht geschehen, ordne Publikationen den Verlagen zu

content.en:
# Import Publishers

If you want to add multiple publishers at once, use the import function. It allows you to import publishers from CSV or Excel files.

## Prerequisites

- You need a CSV file with your publisher data
- File should not exceed 50 MB
- At minimum, company name must be present
- You have permission to create companies

## Step-by-Step Guide

### Step 1: Open Import Dialog

1. Go to **CRM ‚Üí Companies**
2. Click on the **"Publishers"** tab (if available) or use filters
3. Click **"Import"** in the top right corner

The import dialog opens.

[Screenshot: Import button in CRM area]

### Step 2: Download Template

If importing for the first time, download the CSV template:

1. Click **"Download CSV Template"** in the dialog
2. Open the file in Excel or Google Sheets
3. You'll see all available columns with sample data

The template shows you:
- Which fields are available
- Which fields are required (marked with *)
- The correct format for each field
- Example entries for orientation

[Screenshot: CSV template opened in Excel]

> **Tip:** Always use the current template. It's automatically updated with new fields.

### Step 3: Enter Data into Template

Enter your publisher data into the template:

**Required Fields:**
- **Company Name*** ‚Äì Name of the publisher
- **Type*** ‚Äì Enter "publisher" here

**Important Fields for Publishers:**
- **Official Company Name** ‚Äì Full legal name
- **Website** ‚Äì Publisher's website URL
- **Industry** ‚Äì e.g., "Publishing", "Media"
- **Description** ‚Äì Brief description of the publisher

**Address Data:**
- Street, Postal Code, City, State/Region, Country (ISO code like "DE")

**Contact Details:**
- **Phone 1/2**: Type (business/mobile), Country (DE), Number, Primary (yes/no)
- **Email 1/2**: Type (general/press), Address, Primary (yes/no)

**Company Details:**
- **Legal Form** ‚Äì e.g., "GmbH", "Ltd", "Inc"
- **Founded Date** ‚Äì Format: YYYY-MM-DD or DD.MM.YYYY
- **Annual Revenue** ‚Äì Number without currency symbol
- **Currency** ‚Äì ISO code like "EUR"
- **Employee Count** ‚Äì Whole number

**Identifiers (for larger publishers):**
- **Identifier 1/2**: Type (e.g., "VAT_EU"), Value, Authority (country)

**Social Media:**
- LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Xing ‚Äì Full URLs

**Tags:**
- Comma-separated list: "Media, Publisher, Partner"

[Screenshot: Filled CSV template with sample data]

> **Important:** Use semicolon (;) as delimiter. This is the standard for German Excel exports.

### Step 4: Save File

Save your file:

1. Click **File ‚Üí Save As**
2. Choose format **"CSV (Comma delimited) (*.csv)"**
3. Ensure UTF-8 encoding (for special characters)

> **Tip:** If Excel displays umlauts incorrectly, open the CSV file in a text editor and save with UTF-8 encoding.

### Step 5: Upload File

1. Click **"Select File"** in the import dialog or drag the CSV file into the upload area
2. The system shows a **preview** of the first 5 rows
3. Check if data is recognized correctly

[Screenshot: File upload with preview]

### Step 6: Choose Duplicate Handling

Decide how to handle duplicates:

- **Skip** ‚Äì Existing publishers won't be modified (recommended for first import)
- **Update** ‚Äì Existing publishers will be overwritten with new data

Duplicate detection is based on:
- Company name (exact match)
- Website domain (if available)

### Step 7: Start Import

1. Click **"Import"**
2. The system shows a **progress bar** with these phases:
   - **Parsing file** ‚Äì CSV is being read
   - **Validation** ‚Äì Data is checked for errors
   - **Importing** ‚Äì Publishers are created/updated

The import runs in the background. You can close the dialog and continue working.

[Screenshot: Import progress]

### Step 8: Review Results

After import completion, you'll see a **summary**:

- ‚úÖ **Created** ‚Äì Number of newly created publishers
- üîÑ **Updated** ‚Äì Number of updated publishers
- ‚è≠Ô∏è **Skipped** ‚Äì Duplicates (when "Skip" selected)
- ‚ùå **Errors** ‚Äì Rows with issues

**In Case of Errors:**
- The system shows the **row number** and **error reason**
- You can correct the CSV file and repeat the import
- Already imported data won't be duplicated

[Screenshot: Import result with statistics]

## Common Errors and Solutions

### "Company name is required"

**Problem:** A row has no value in the "Company Name*" column

**Solution:** Add a company name for each row or remove empty rows

### "Invalid date format"

**Problem:** Founded date is not in expected format

**Solution:** Use one of these formats:
- `2015-03-15` (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `15.03.2015` (DD.MM.YYYY)

### "Invalid type"

**Problem:** The "Type*" column contains an invalid value

**Solution:** Use one of these values:
- `publisher` (for publishers)
- `customer` (for customers)
- `partner` (for partners)
- `media_house` (for media houses)
- `agency` (for agencies)

### "Invalid phone/email format"

**Problem:** Phone number or email address is incorrectly formatted

**Solution:**
- **Phone:** Use format "30 12345678" (without country code in number)
- **Email:** Check for typos and correct format (name@domain.com)

### CSV file not recognized correctly

**Problem:** Excel saved the file with wrong delimiters

**Solution:**
1. Open CSV file in a text editor (e.g., Notepad++)
2. Check if semicolon (;) is used as delimiter
3. Ensure file is UTF-8 encoded

## Tips for Successful Imports

### 1. Test with Small Datasets

Before importing hundreds of publishers:
- Start with 3-5 test entries
- Check results in CRM
- Only then import the full list

### 2. Use Tags for Categorization

Tags help you filter publishers later:
- "Premium" for important publisher partners
- "Regional" for local publishers
- "Specialist" for specialized publishers

### 3. Maintain Complete Contact Details

The more information you import:
- The easier future contact will be
- The better duplicate detection works
- The more professional your database appears

### 4. Keep a Master File

Save your CSV file as master:
- You can update it when needed
- You have a backup outside CeleroPress
- You can track changes

### 5. Import in Stages

For very large datasets (>1000 rows):
- Split the file into smaller files
- Import in batches (e.g., alphabetically)
- This helps narrow down errors

## After Import

After successful import, you should:

1. **Review publishers** ‚Äì Spot-check imported data
2. **Assign publications** ‚Äì If not done yet, assign publications to publishers
3. **Link journalists** ‚Äì Connect journalists with their publishers
4. **Create distribution lists** ‚Äì Use imported publishers for distributions

## Next Steps

- [Edit Publisher](/support/en/crm/verlag-bearbeiten) ‚Äì Adjust individual publishers afterwards
- [Import Publications](/support/en/publikationen-importieren) ‚Äì Add publications to publishers
- [Import Journalists](/support/en/crm/journalisten-importieren) ‚Äì Link contacts with publishers
- [Create Distribution Lists](/support/en/crm/verteiler-erstellen) ‚Äì Group publishers and journalists into distributions
